title: Evan Peters gives update on ‘American Horror Story' with Ariana Grande
description: Originally appeared on E! Online.Evan Peters is getting into position for Ariana Grande to join “American Horror Story.“Following the Halloween 2025 announcement that the “Wicked: For Good” actress will star alongside the Emmy winner in season 13 of the anthology series, he detailed the benefit of having Grande join the Ryan Murphy show.“What doesn’t she bring to the cast?” Peters, who with Grande in her “we can’t be friends” music video, told E! News’ Will Marfuggi in an exclusive interview. “She’s an incredible performer and actress, and I think that’s gonna be awesome to have her on board.”And the “Monster: The Jeffrey Dahmer Story” actor is looking forward to what the future has in store with Grande — who previously starred in Murphy’s 2015 show “Scream Queens” — and the rest of the cast, including AHS alums Jessica Lange, Kathy Bates and Emma Roberts. He’s particularly eager to see how Murphy utilizes all of Grande’s different talents for the small screen. Celebrity NewsNov 29, 2025Ariana Grande shares ‘loving reminder' amid body-shaming criticismMoviesNov 25, 2025Why Ariana Grande and Jonathan Bailey's kiss was cut from ‘Wicked: For Good'MoviesJul 15, 2025Ariana Grande reveals next movie role — involving Dr. SeussREAD: Ariana Grande and Jonathan Bailey are teaming up again for new project after ‘Wicked‘“I’m excited to see what’s gonna be in the season,” he continued. “I haven’t read anything yet, so I’m curious what it’s gonna be, what’s it gonna have her doing. It’s exciting.”In the meantime, Peters has teamed up with Murphy for another must-watch show, explaining why he enjoyed working with the TV mastermind on “The Beauty,” starring Ashton Kutcher and Rebecca Hall and premiering Jan. 21 at 9 p.m. ET on Hulu and FX. “He’s just an incredible collaborator,” Peters shared of Murphy. “As strong as his vision is, he’s willing to take ideas in and try them, and you definitely get to have some say.”Indeed, he inadvertently referenced the new show while detailed their working relationship, adding, “That’s the beauty of it.”As for what drew Peters to star in “The Beauty,” which he described as an “international sci-fi satirical body horror action thriller”?“These really long action sequences,” he said, “and playing the FBI agent and trying to take down the evil corporation was all very intriguing, for sure.”While “The Beauty” premieres on Hulu and FX on Jan. 21, season 13 of American Horror Story doesn’t arrive until Halloween 2026.

title: Super Value: ‘No guarantee’ all items VAT re-priced by April 1
description: Super Value’s president yesterday she cannot “make any promises” that all product prices will reflect VAT’s elimination on unprepared foods at the April 1 deadline given the mammoth task involved in adjusting thousands of goods that account for 80 percent of its sales.

title: ITV The Chase new spin-off revealed with travel-themed twist
description: Bradley Walsh will host The Chase spin-off, a new series where contestants travel globally to track down the Chasers in secret locations

title: Scottish Government set to cut 11,000 public sector jobs in £1.5bn savings bid
description: Finance Secretary Shona Robison has said that £1.5 billion would need to be trimmed from Scotland's budget to “protect investment in frontline services”.

title: Cardinal Corner: Men’s, women’s hoops take down Potsdam
description: PLATTSBURGH — Khalil Screen and Reem Welch each delivered standout performances as the Plattsburgh State men’s basketball team rolled past Potsdam, 101-78, in SUNY Athletic Conference play Tuesday night in Memorial Hall.

title: Singapore port sets new performance records in 2025
description: Total vessel arrival tonnage at the Port of Singapore last year hit an all-time high of 3.22 billion tonnes, up 3.5% compared with 2024. Singapore probes transnational baby trafficking ringSingapore considers building 6th desalination plantUnpaid credit card balances in Singapore hit record high in 10 years

title: No. 25 Seton Hall’s rally comes up short against No. 3 UConn
description: No. 3 UConn extended its winning streak to 13 games with a 69-64 win over No. 25 Seton Hall on Tuesday night.
